103767.name: owls
103767.gauge_description: 13 stitches and 20 rows = 4 inches in stocking stitch
103767.notes_html:
o w l s

Seamless yoke sweater with iconic cabled owls

Size and fit
o w l s can be worn as a neat-fitting sweater, with slight
negative ease, or as a more comfortable winter layering
sweater. For a neat fit, choose the size in the table below
your actual measurements and for a comfortable fit, the size
above.

Needles and notions
80-100cm / 32-40in gauge-size and below-gauge-size
needle for body and yoke. Gauge-size and below-gaugesize
needle(s) of your preferred type for working small
circumferences. 32 (36, 36, 38, 40, 42, 44, 48) x 0.5cm
/ ¼in buttons (optional). Waste yarn. Stitch markers of 2
different types, x and y. Cable needle. Tapestry needle

Yarn
New Lanark Chunky (bulky weight) 120m /100g 5 (5, 6, 6, 7, 7, 7, 8) x 100g balls. Yarn quantities are approximate
and include 5% extra for swatching and small variations in
gauge.

Gauge
13 sts and 20 rounds to 10cm / 4in over stockinette in the round. Gauge was achieved with a 6.5mm (US 10½) needle.

Pattern Notes
o w l s is a seamless yoked sweater, knit in the round from the bottom up. The body is worked in one piece with the waist shaped by 2 sets of decreases at the back and sides. Stitches are put on hold at the underarms, sleeves are worked in the round, and body and sleeves are joined into a circular yoke. The owl cable is then worked around the yoke (take your choice of either charted or written instructions), and the neckline is shaped by decreases and short rows. The sweater is finished by grafting the underarm stiches and together. If you would prefer your sweater to have a less fitted shape, you may choose to omit the waist and bust shaping

216824.name: Clapo-Ktus
216824.notes_html:
E’ disponibile la versione PDF in italiano

March 2014: I’ve just uploaded a revised version of the pattern. I hope this way all the questions will find an answer.
thank you for your patience and thank you for choosing to knit this versatile shawl!!! I love it and I’m still wearing the first one I have ever knitted.

A hybrid between clapotis and baktus scarf, this shawl lets you use the exact amount of yarn you have. It’s perfect to stash-down all of those single skeins of socks yarn sitting somewhere in your house! As many Baktus knitters have proved so far, it works with any kind of yarn.

Thanks to chronicknitting for the suggestion:
It occurred to me that I maybe didn’t need to do the ribbing on the back as well as the front and I checked with the designer, who thought it would be OK as long as the yarn isn’t too sticky, and of course this one isn’t at all. I’ve just passed the centre point so I’m dropping stitches now and it’s great fun.

pattern_author.name: UniqueCreazioni
pattern_author.notes:
Knitting, knitting and more knitting, it's not an hobby but a lifestyle! I don't know when I learnt how to knit. I have a "memoir" of myself knitting during the summer vacations in high school but I was already able to knit sweaters. After a long break I started again in 2003  while expecting Emma. I haven't stopped ever since and my stash has grown so much! 
Designing has been a natural development of my "knitter life". Mostly I design accessories. My designing "philosophy" is: Unique, Simple, Colors and Mindless!



For questions regarding the Sagrantino Shawl, please visit the [Sagrantino Shawl KAL][3] forum. It started as a KAL Group but right now is a great source of informations.


  [1]: http://www.etsy.com/shop/uniquecreazioni
  [2]: http://www.etsy.com/shop/uniquecreazioni
  [3]: http://www.ravelry.com/groups/sagrantino-shawl-kal

226669.name: Cadence Socks
226669.gauge_description: 7 stitches and 13 rows = 1 inch in stockinette
226669.notes_html:
Join the Verybusymonkey Knitters Group

Formerly “SKA March Mystery Sock”.

Clue #1 posted 3/1/11
Clue #2 posted 3/8/11
Clue #3 posted 3/14/11
Clue #4 posted 3/21/11

Yarn suggestions:
Medium-weight fingering yarn, and needles to get you approximate gauge. Since I was assigned lace as my technique to use, the pattern is pretty stretchy. If you’re worried about the pattern being too small (as there is only one size), then adjust your yarn weight or needle size to increase gauge a little bit.

As for color: Anything between a solid color and more subtle variegation would be good. Don’t be afraid to use variegated yarn, but I would advise against variegated yarns where the colors are really, really contrasting - the pattern will get lost.

If it helps, my version is knit in Malabrigo sock in the Primavera colorway on US size 1.5 dpns. This yarn is a bit lighter than medium-weight sock yarn, and not a super stretchy yarn, but it is lovely and shows off the pattern nicely. I think if I had any around, I would have used a sock yarn with a base like Louet gems - I think that would be perfect!

users.fave_colors: Any strong, deep, rich colors, no pastels for me!
users.about_me:
When I was a little girl, the only thing I wanted from the time I could speak was to ride horses. My parents, knowing horseback riding is a costly hobby  that would only lead to me wanting my own horse, tried to distract me. 

I roller skated, I danced, and I took every craft class known to mankind. I can now do pretty much any craft thrown in front of me, but the only one that stuck oddly enough was crochet and in the years since I showered every close friend and family member with at least one afghan. 

Knitting, I always thought, was too boring, required too much counting, didn't have the stitch variation like crochet, and, most importantly, just took too long. But several years ago, while studying for a large Ph.D. qualifying exam, I realized that I needed to keep my hands busy while I sat around nervously studying and reading all day. Crochet was out because I need to look at what I'm doing for that, but knitting actually worked. 

I still do a bit of crochet, needlework, etc. from time to time, but I've been knitting obsessively ever since. Oh, and I now have two horses. :)

I now have a [group on Ravelry][1]! If you've got questions about my patterns or want to contact me about designing, RavMail is fine or you can email me at verybusymonkeydesigns@gmail.com. Happy knitting everyone!

****We do quarterly KAL's in my group if you're interested in joining us! [Here's a link!][2]****

[**To catch sneak peeks of works in progress, follow me on instagram here.**][3]


  [1]: http://www.ravelry.com/groups/verybusymonkey-knitters
  [2]: http://www.ravelry.com/groups/verybusymonkey-knitters
  [3]: https://www.instagram.com/verybusymonkey/

490330.name: Love in a Mist
490330.gauge_description: 19 stitches  = 4 inches in stocking stitch after blocking
490330.notes_html:
SPECIAL OFFER - GET ONE FREE! - Add five patterns, including collections/ebooks (each collection/ebook counts as one pattern), from my Ravelry Store in one single transaction and get the least expensive one free.
Please Note that this will not work in conjunction with any other promotion.

Love in a Mist is available as an individual download or as part of the Things Unknown - Dream Collection, a collection of four patterns, three individual and one exclusive to the collection, representing a large saving. This collection is part of the Dream Collection Trio - Three Collections all inspired by Midsummer Night’s Dream.

Love in a Mist takes inspiration from Puck’s mischief, his interfering and potion use has everyone’s love in a mist and a mix. A clear and uncluttered, stocking stitch body becomes a web of romantic lace interspersed with jewel-like beads. No mist here though, it is easy to see how simple and lovely this little shawl is; pretty as a picture and a piece of cake to knit. You will be wearing your new, crescent shaped, lovely in no time at all!
Knit here in a Paysages Merino/Silk Single (400yards/100g) by Shleep Yarns (size shown required more than one skein of yarn though size is adaptable and guidelines are given within the pattern). This pattern is suitable for most fingering weight yarns.

The pattern is both written and fully colour charted with bead placement indicated throughout.

If you like my designs please join us in the Boo Group where you will find a place to discuss my patterns, show off your knitting and hear about KALs and MKALs.

Patterns already set up by KnitCompanion can be purchased, in the KnitCompanion Store, for knitters who like to use KnitCompanion, but prefer to have their charts already set up.

497647.name: Dotted Rays
497647.gauge_description: 20 stitches and 48 rows = 4 inches in garter stitch
497647.notes_html:
This arched shawl begins at the center with only a few stitches while yarn over increases quickly expand the shape. Garter stitch short row wedges add length to one side forming rays that gradually increase in size. The repetitive knit stitches and rhythmic short rows are easy to work while still keeping your interest, a perfect travel project! Built in I-cord edges and an I-cord bind off outline the entire shape for a clean finish. Choose one yarn or use different stash and scrap yarns for a striped effect.

Available in Japanese here All other translations available on Ravelry..

Size: Small Large

Finished Measurements: 60 92“ / 152 234cm wingspan, 13 22” / 33 56cm longest part between I-cord edges. Measurements taken after blocking.
The small version knit with worsted weight yarn measures 82” / 208cm wingspan, 21” / 53cm long between I-cord edges.

Yarn: Fingering weight

Yardage: 720 1200yds / 658 1097m
900yds / 823m used for the small version (pink) knit with worsted weight yarn

The large striped version used about 1200yds / 1097m total. Gather a colorful array of scraps and single skeins to work a similarly striped shawl. The last short row wedge of the large size used about 230yds / 210m and the second to last short row wedge used about 220yds / 201m.

Shown in: Small Version (green)
The Plucky Knitter Primo Fingering
Colorway - With a PH

Large Version (striped)
Madelinetosh Tosh Merino Light
Viola Sock
Malabrigo Lace (held double)
A Verb for Keeping Warm Even Tinier Annapurna
A Verb for Keeping Warm Floating
The Plucky Knitter Primo Fingering
Elsa Wool Cormo Fingering
Skein Top Draw Socks
Malabrigo Sock
Orkney Angora St. Magnus DK

Worsted Weight Pink Version (small size)
Quince & Co. Owl
Colorway - Canyon
Knitting the small size with thicker yarn like worsted weight will yield a larger shawl.

Needles: 40” US 6 / 4mm circular
40” US 8 / 5mm circular used for small worsted weight version

Notions: Tapestry needle

Gauge: 20 sts & 48 rows = 4” / 10cm in garter stitch with US 6 / 4mm needles & fingering weight yarn
16 sts & 32 rows = 4” / 10cm in garter stitch with US 8 / 5mm needles & worsted weight yarns

Pattern Notes: For a striped shawl, change colors whenever you like. Change colors at the beginning of any RS row. If you want to have a striped look like the large striped version, then add an accent stripe for the yarn over RS and WS rows like Rows 7 & 8, Rows 9 & 10, Rows 11 & 12, etc… These accent stripes feature a contrasting color for only 2 rows (or 1 garter ridge). Then, knit the entire short row wedge in another color. For strong graphic contrast, select yarn over accent stripes (the single garter ridge stripes) that are much brighter or darker than the short row wedge colors.

Photography & makeup by Alexandra Feo

Errata: There are some little adjustments to a few of the rows in Dotted Rays. One stitch was off in the following rows. These are the correct rows and they are represented in the updated English pattern PDF “Dotted_Rays-4.pdf”. The update was sent February 27, 2019.

Row 28 (WS): K15, (k1/p1 into double yo, k12) 18 times, k1/p1 into double yo, k11, sl3 wyif.

Row 29 (RS): K3, kfb, k2, (ssk, yo twice, k12) 21 times, k1, sl3 wyif. 326 sts.

Row 31 (RS): K3, kfb, k10, (ssk, yo twice, k13) 22 times, k1, sl3 wyif. 371 sts.

Row 32 (WS): K17, (k1/p1 into double yo, k14) 21 times, k1/p1 into double yo, k13, sl3 wyif.

Large Version (striped)
Madelinetosh Tosh Merino Light
Viola Sock
Malabrigo Lace (held double)
A Verb for Keeping Warm Even Tinier Annapurna
A Verb for Keeping Warm Floating
The Plucky Knitter Primo Fingering
Elsa Wool Cormo Fingering
Skein Top Draw Socks
Malabrigo Sock
Orkney Angora St. Magnus DK

Worsted Weight Pink Version (small size)
Quince & Co. Owl
Colorway - Canyon
Knitting the small size with thicker yarn like worsted weight will yield a larger shawl.

**Needles:** 40" US 6 / 4mm circular
40" US 8 / 5mm circular used for small worsted weight version

**Notions:** Tapestry needle

**Gauge:** 20 sts & 48 rows = 4" / 10cm in garter stitch with US 6 / 4mm needles & fingering weight yarn
16 sts & 32 rows = 4" / 10cm in garter stitch with US 8 / 5mm needles & worsted weight yarns

**Pattern Notes:** For a striped shawl, change colors whenever you like. Change colors at the beginning of any RS row. If you want to have a striped look like the large striped version, then add an accent stripe for the yarn over RS and WS rows like Rows 7 & 8, Rows 9 & 10, Rows 11 & 12, etc… These accent stripes feature a contrasting color for only 2 rows (or 1 garter ridge). Then, knit the entire short row wedge in another color. For strong graphic contrast, select yarn over accent stripes (the single garter ridge stripes) that are much brighter or darker than the short row wedge colors. 

Photography & makeup by Alexandra Feo

**Errata:** There are some little adjustments to a few of the rows in Dotted Rays. One stitch was off in the following rows. These are the correct rows and they are represented in the updated English pattern PDF "Dotted_Rays-4.pdf". The update was sent February 27, 2019.

**Row 28 (WS):** K15, (k1/p1 into double yo, k12) 18 times, k1/p1 into double yo, k11, sl3 wyif.

**Row 29 (RS):** K3, kfb, k2, (ssk, yo twice, k12) 21 times, k1, sl3 wyif. 326 sts.

**Row 31 (RS):** K3, kfb, k10, (ssk, yo twice, k13) 22 times, k1, sl3 wyif. 371 sts.

**Row 32 (WS):** K17, (k1/p1 into double yo, k14) 21 times, k1/p1 into double yo, k13, sl3 wyif. 



  [1]: http://atelier-knits.com/shop/makimono/dotted-rays/

497856.name: Pixelated Pullover
497856.notes_html:
Pixelated Pullover is a contiguous set-in-sleeve sweater that has striking stranded color shifts flowing completely seamlessly from the top down, knit almost entirely in the round. The playful and flattering color work highlights the face and defines the figure. A perfect fit may be customized through the princess shaping.

This pattern is included as part of the Pixelated Sweater Collection with Little Pixels Pullover and Sugar Plum Cardigan. If you have previously purchased one of these patterns, receive a discounted price on the collection, by using the codes “Pixelated” for a previous purchase of Pixelated Pullover (receive 50% off the collection) or “Little Pixels” for a previous purchase of the two other children’s patterns (receive 55% off) or “Little One” (Little Pixels) or “Sugar Plum” (Sugar Plum Cardigan) for a previous purchase of just one of the children’s sweaters for 40% off the collection.

  • SIZES finished bust circumference: 30 (32, 34, 36, 38, 40, 42, 44, 46, 48, 50, 52)” / 76 (81.5, 85.5, 91.5, 96.5, 101.5, 106.5, 112, 117, 123, 127, 132) cm Shown in size 30” / 76 cm on a 30” high bust with 2” negative ease at full bust. Choose the size closest to your high bust. If you are in between sizes, size up.

  • GAUGE 20 sts and 28 rows = 4”/ 10cm in stockinette, and in stranded stockinette after blocking. To save time, please take time to check gauge in stockinette and in colorwork pattern.

  • YARN heavy dk or light worsted wool yarn in 3 colors that can be knit in stockinette and stranded stockinette color work at pattern gauge, such as Madelinetosh DK Twist, Astral Bath Spectra DK or The Plucky Knitter Trusty, all 250 yd skeins. color 1 — 1 ( 1, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2) skeins or actual yardage: 222 ( 250, 271, 286, 300, 319, 341, 351, 368, 409, 426, 449) yds, 203 (229, 248, 261.5, 275, 292, 312, 321, 336.5, 374, 389.5, 410.5) m color 2 — 2 ( 2, 2, 2, 2, 3, 3, 3, 3, 3, 3, 3) skeins or actual yardage: 359 ( 405, 439, 464, 487, 516, 552, 568, 596, 662, 690, 727) yds, 328 (370, 401.5, 424, 445, 472, 505, 519, 545, 605, 631, 665) m color 3 – 2 ( 3, 3, 3, 3, 3, 3, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4) skeins or actual yardage: 475 (535, 580, 614, 644, 683, 731, 752, 788, 876, 914, 963) yds, 434.5 (489, 530.5, 561.5, 589, 624.5, 668.5, 687.5, 720.5, 801, 836, 880.5) m

  • NEEDLES & NOTIONS US 6 / 4.0 mm circular knitting needle in 32”/ 81 cm length” or preferred length for knitting sweater body in the round, US 6 / 4.0mm in preferred style for small circumference knitting in the round or size needed to obtain gauge, tapestry needle, 6 stitch markers

  • SKILLS stranded knitting with two colors; reading charts; knitting in the round; knitting small circumference in the round; purling; increasing and decreasing; picking up sts

  • CONTIGUOUS Pixelated pullover is a sweater is worked seamlessly from the top down using the contiguous sleeve method developed by Susie Myers (SusieM on Ravelry.) The stranded color work is almost completely knit in the round.

  • SHAPING The princess darts will allow the knitter to customize the shaping for her figure. As with any sweater pattern, study the schematic to select your size and decide on modifications to the arm, waist or hip shaping. I recommend a couple of inches of ease at the waist. If your waist size is larger, you will work fewer waist shaping decreases, and then also fewer hip shaping increases. There is some extra hip shaping included in the pattern to account for the changes in fabric throughout the sweater (the stranded portions are thicker and less stretchy). For example, the hip measurement includes a bit of ease for the wearer to account for the stranded fabric around the hips. Some positive ease at the hips is recommend for a sweater that flows freely from the waist to the hips without bunching. It is very important that the knitter maintains a consistent gauge between the stranded and solid portions of the sweater.

  • COLOR When selecting your three colors, look for contrast between all three (particularly in weight--darkness to lightness). They will be contrasted in every possible combination. Also, consider “what effect will these colors have on you?” Color 1 frames the face. The other colors are going to highlight different areas of the figure. Heavier, deeper colors will recede; lighter brighter colors will pop forward.

Technical editing by Lori Law

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Der „Pixelpulli ”ist ein nach der Contiguous-Methode von oben nach unten nahtlos in Runden gearbeiteter Pullover mit gleichzeitig eingestrickten Ärmeln. Das dreifarbige Jaquardmuster betont das Gesicht der Trägerin und bringt in Verbindung mit optionaler Taillierung die Figur besonders vorteilhaft zur Geltung.

Kenntnisse und Fertigkeiten
• Stricken mit zwei Farben gleichzeitig und auf der Rückseite mitgeführten Spannfäden
• Arbeit nach mehrfarbigen Strickschriften
• Stricken in Runden, auch bei kleinerem Rundenumfang
• Rechte und linke Maschen, Maschen zusammenstricken
• Maschen aus dem Querfaden herausstricken
• Maschen anschlagen und abketten

Benötigt werden
• Garn mit einer Maschenprobe von 20 M auf 10 cm in 3 verschiedenen Farben, z.B. Madelinetosh DK Twist, Astral Bath Spectra DK oder The Plucky Knitter Trusty, erhältlich in 250-Yard-Knäueln.
Farbe 1 – 1 (1, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2) Knäuel, Gesamtverbrauch: 222 (250, 271, 286, 300, 319, 341, 351, 368, 409, 426, 449) Yards bzw. 203 (229, 248, 261.5, 275, 292, 312, 321, 336.5, 374, 389.5, 410.5) m
Farbe 2 – 2 (2, 2, 2, 2, 3, 3, 3, 3, 3, 3, 3) Knäuel, Gesamtverbrauch: 359 (405, 439, 464, 487, 516, 552, 568, 596, 662, 690, 727) Yards bzw. 328 (370, 401.5, 424, 445, 472, 505, 519, 545, 605, 631, 665) m.
Farbe 3 – 2 (3, 3, 3, 3, 3, 3, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4) Knäuel, Gesamtverbrauch: 475 (535, 580, 614, 644, 683, 731, 752, 788, 876, 914, 963) Yards bzw. 434.5 (489, 530.5, 561.5, 589, 624.5, 668.5, 687.5, 720.5, 801, 836, 880.5) m .
• Rundstricknadel US 6 / 4.0 mm, 32”/ 81 cm lang + kürzere für den Ärmelumfang
• Wollnadel
• 6 Maschenmarkierer

Maschenprobe
20 M und 28 R auf 4”/10 cm in glatt rechts und in Jacquard glatt rechts nach dem Spannen.

Größe
Brustumfang am fertigen Pullover – 30 (32, 34, 36, 38, 40, 42, 44, 46, 48, 50, 52)“ / 76 (81.5, 85.5, 91.5, 96.5, 101.5, 106.5, 112, 117, 123, 127, 132) cm. Der abgebildete Pullover hat einen Oberbrustumfang von 30”/ 76 cm, gezeigt an einer Figur mit 30” OBU.

Maschenweise ausgeschriebene Anleitung (8 Seiten) mit Schemazeichnung und mehrfarbiger Strickschrift.

Aus dem Englischen übersetzt von Katharina Sokiran Manfredovna on Ravelry.

617705.name: Liguria
617705.gauge_description: 20 stitches and 22 rows = 4 inches in brioche stitch
617705.notes_html:
I designed the LIGURIA hat in Italy during my last holiday. Love the landscape, people and food of this Mediterranean region so much. Can´t wait to come back to this lovely inspiring place.

This slightly slouchy beanie is knitted in an easy brioche stitch pattern, four repeating pattern rounds are forming some leafs all over the hat. A perfect beanie for you to start two-color brioche stitch. Most surprising thing was it to shape the crown of this hat, only by omitting the increases. It´s so easy and so much fun!

Come find me over on instagram!
@katta_rinah

Pattern is written for three circumference small, medium and large to fit the child and average adult female.

MEASUREMENTS S ( M, L) 16” (18”,20 “)/ 40cm (45cm, 50cm)
DEPTH 9,5” (9,5”, 10,5”) / 24cm (24cm, 27cm)
YARN Altogether approximately 202 (218, 235) yards / 185, (200m, 215m) of DK weight yarn for the beanie version.

Shown beanie sample (M) was knit with Sweet Georgia Superwash DK (100% Merino, 256 yards/ 4.06 ounces, 234m /114g) in Peony (MC) and Raspberry (CC), the slouchy beanie sample was knit with Sweet Georgia Superwash DK in Birch (MC) and Tumbled Stone (CC)
You can also use any other DK weight yarn.

NEEDLES
dpns and 16” (40cm) circular needle in US 4/ 3,5mm or size required to obtain gauge
NOTIONS
1 st marker and a tapestry needle for weaving in ends
GAUGE
20 sts, 22 rounds = 4” / 10cm in blocked brioche stitch
TECHNIQUES
cast on, k, p, Brk, Brp, brkyobrk, brRsl

Die LIGURIA Mütze habe ich im letzten Italienurlaub gestrickt. Die mediterrane Landschaft, die Menschen und natürlich das regionale Essen haben mich begeistert. Ich freue mich jetzt schon auf ein Wiedersehen.
Die Mütze ist in einem zweifarbigen Patentmuster gestrickt, vier sich stetig wiederholende Musterreihen bilden ein florales All-over-Muster. Eine perfekte Mütze, um endlich mit dem zweifarbigen Patentmuster loszulegen. Die große Überraschung ist die markante Blüte als Abschluss , sie entsteht einfach durch Weglassen der Zunahmen. Es kann so einfach sein!

Das Muster ist geschrieben für drei Größen klein (Kinder 8-12 Jahre), mittel und groß. Wenn erforderlich, sind die Angaben für die verschiedenen Größen in Klammern angegeben, wie folgt: S (M, L ).

UMFANG 40cm (45cm, 50cm)
HÖHE 24cm (24cm, 27cm)
GARN Insgesamt ungefähr 185, (200m, 215m) Merinowolle DK

Die gezeigten Mützen (beide Größe M) wurden gestrickt mit SweetGeorgia Superwash DK (100% Merino , 234m /114g) in den Farben Peony und Raspberry, und mit SweetGeorgia Superwash DK in den Farben Birch und Tumbled Stone

NADELN
3,5mm Rundstricknadel 40cm und Nadelspiel in gleicher Stärke. Bitte die Nadelstärke entsprechend der Maschenprobe wählen.

ZUBEHÖR
Maschenmarkierer und eine Nadel zum Vernähen der Fäden

MASCHENPROBE
20 M / 22 Runden = 10 x 10cm im Patenmuster

TECHNIKEN
Maschenanschlag, rechte und linke Maschen, rechte und linke Patentmaschen, Ab- und Zunahmen von 2 Patentmaschen
617705.notes:
I designed the LIGURIA hat in Italy during my last holiday. Love the landscape, people and food of this Mediterranean region so much. Can´t wait to come back to this lovely inspiring place. 

This slightly slouchy beanie is knitted in an easy brioche stitch pattern, four repeating pattern rounds  are forming some leafs all over the hat.  A perfect beanie for you to start two-color brioche stitch. Most surprising thing was it to shape the crown of this hat, only by omitting the increases. It´s so easy and so much fun! 

Come find me over on instagram!
@katta_rinah

Pattern is written for three circumference small, medium and large to fit the child and average adult female. 

MEASUREMENTS S ( M, L) 16" (18",20 ")/ 40cm (45cm, 50cm)
DEPTH  9,5" (9,5", 10,5") / 24cm (24cm, 27cm)
YARN	 Altogether approximately 202 (218, 235) yards / 185, (200m, 215m) of DK weight yarn for the beanie version. 

Shown beanie sample (M) was knit with Sweet Georgia Superwash DK (100% Merino, 256 yards/ 4.06 ounces, 234m /114g) in Peony (MC)  and Raspberry (CC), the slouchy beanie sample was knit with Sweet Georgia Superwash DK in Birch (MC) and Tumbled Stone (CC) 
You can also use any other DK weight yarn. 

NEEDLES 
dpns and 16" (40cm) circular needle in US 4/ 3,5mm or size 	required to obtain gauge
NOTIONS  
1 st marker and a tapestry needle for weaving in ends
GAUGE	
20 sts, 22 rounds = 4" / 10cm in blocked brioche stitch	
TECHNIQUES	  
cast on, k, p, Brk, Brp, brkyobrk, brRsl

Die LIGURIA Mütze habe ich im letzten Italienurlaub gestrickt. Die mediterrane Landschaft, die Menschen und natürlich das regionale Essen haben mich begeistert. Ich freue mich jetzt schon auf ein Wiedersehen. 
Die Mütze ist in einem zweifarbigen Patentmuster gestrickt, vier sich stetig wiederholende Musterreihen bilden ein florales All-over-Muster. Eine perfekte Mütze, um endlich mit dem zweifarbigen Patentmuster loszulegen.  Die große Überraschung ist die markante Blüte als Abschluss , sie entsteht einfach durch Weglassen der Zunahmen. Es kann so einfach sein! 

Das Muster ist geschrieben für drei Größen klein (Kinder 8-12 Jahre), mittel und groß. Wenn erforderlich, sind die Angaben für die verschiedenen Größen in Klammern angegeben, wie folgt: S (M, L ). 

UMFANG	 		40cm (45cm, 50cm)
HÖHE			24cm (24cm, 27cm)
GARN			Insgesamt ungefähr 185, (200m, 215m) Merinowolle DK

Die gezeigten Mützen (beide Größe M) wurden gestrickt mit SweetGeorgia Superwash DK (100% Merino , 234m /114g) in den Farben Peony  und Raspberry, und mit 	SweetGeorgia Superwash DK in den Farben Birch und Tumbled Stone 

NADELN			
3,5mm Rundstricknadel 40cm  und Nadelspiel in gleicher Stärke. Bitte die Nadelstärke entsprechend der Maschenprobe wählen. 

ZUBEHÖR		
Maschenmarkierer und eine Nadel zum Vernähen der Fäden

MASCHENPROBE		
20 M / 22 Runden = 10 x 10cm im Patenmuster	

TECHNIKEN		
Maschenanschlag, rechte und linke Maschen, rechte und linke Patentmaschen, Ab- und Zunahmen von 2 Patentmaschen

669230.name: The Rain Outside
669230.gauge_description: 18 stitches and 28 rows = 4 inches in Garter knit flat and blocked.
669230.notes_html:
Print copies of Shawl Joy are now available to order on my Etsy shop!

“And as he drove on, the rainclouds dragged down the sky after him, for, though he did not know it, he was a Rain God. All he knew was that his working days were miserable and he had a succession of lousy holidays. All the clouds knew was that they loved him and wanted to be near him, to cherish him, and to water him.”

~ Douglas Adams

The Rain Outside is the sister shawl to Waiting for Rain. It uses the same technique, which I’ve named Softsweater’s Charted Lace Short Row Technique! Little lace rips, or lace windows within the garter makes these projects highly unique!

The shawl fits elegantly over shoulders, but it’s perfectly happy to be wrapped up tight around your neck for warmth too. It’s worked top down with big lace-y increases.

Lace and garter always are in such lovely contrast with one another.

This project was knit with very special yarn. Two skeins of Sweet Fiber Merino Twist DK in Charcoal and one skein in Smoke. Sweet Fiber has won my heart! I hope you’ll consider knitting this and any of my project in her yarns, if you pop over to her online shop she’s got kits available for this shawl!

I hope you enjoy!

I’d love to have you join my mailing list or visit me over on instagram. I’m @softsweater on there.

Thanks again to my tech editor and model Nicola Hodges from Tiny Island Textiles!

pattern_author.notes:
My name's Sylvia (you can call me softsweater). These are my designs! I hope you like. 

Feel free to join me on my [mailing list][1], or on my [instagram][2] to get notified of new pattern publishes. I also just love instagram a lot, so I hope you'll join me on there! 

If you're interested in one of my for-pay patterns and you find yourself low on funds - please feel free to send me an email (www.softsweaterknits@gmail.com). I'll be happy to gift you a copy! Just please remember to let me know the name of the pattern that's caught your eye, and your username! I'll need both to gift the pattern :) 

As someone who has been low-income most of my life it is important to me to be able to make my designs accessible to folks in tight financial situations! It's also important for me to be able to keep designing part-time accessible to myself by charging money for my patterns :) Win/win situation I think! 

**For all inquiries please email softsweaterknits@gmail.com! If you have any pattern questions please consider posting on my [Softsweater Knits group forum][6]! I no longer answer inquiries over Rav mail, apologies for the inconvenience! :)**



</break>

These **bundles** below are sorted by themes! I have noticed that quite a few of my patterns reflect on light & dark, rain & water, trees and heart.

676427.name: Worsted Brioche Bandana Cowl
676427.sizes_available: 24“ around, 15”  from cast on to point.
676427.gauge_description: 13 stitches and 20 rows = 4 inches in Brioche Stitch
676427.notes_html:
This stylish unisex cowl is knit in the 2 color brioche stitch. The pattern is worked both in the round and flat. It’s tapered in the back so it fits nicely around the neck and under the jacket. One size fits most, this is warm and super soft. 24“ around, 15” from cast on to point.

MATERIALS
US 8 16” circular needle.
Stitch marker.
110 Yards of Color A in Worsted or Aran weight yarn
100 yards of Color B in Worsted or Aran weight yarn.

GAUGE
13 stitches and 20 rows = 4” in brioche stitch on US 8 needles

This pattern has been updated. Please download 2018 version, I’ve left the old pdf up for archival reasons and for those who have WIPs on the needles. You can also now purchase the Brioche Bandana Cowl Collection as an eBook!

714457.name: Kindness KAL Shawl
714457.sizes_available: One Size. approx 52" wingspan by 18" length.
714457.gauge_description: 18 stitches and 30 rows = 4 inches in Stockinette st, blocked
714457.notes_html:
Mesh, lace and a soothing color make the Kindness KAL shawl a lovely project to keep or give to a loved one. Intuitive increase construction and understandable lace patterns make it less difficult than it may first appear! Finish before March 1, 2017 and Knitcircus will donate to a good cause!
Learn more about the KAL in the Ravelry Knitcircus Group

Compassion powers, activate!
Note: there’s a typo in the pattern: please K3 at end of WS rows 94-100 rather than K2.

The pattern is written for one 100g cake of either Knitcircus Fairy Dust (sparkly!) or Trampoline (100% USA Sourced/Milled/Dyed). Feel free to use stash yarn with similar yardage, too. :)

Find the kits at knitcircus.com!

For the rest of the month of March:

- the patterns in my Ravelry store will be 25% off with the code SPREADLIGHTNOTGERMS

- BUT if you email (bristol@bristolivy.com) or DM me proof of your purchase from an independent yarnie or yarn store, I’ll provide you with a seeekrit code and up the discount to 50%

- for those patterns that sell at 25% off, I’ll be donating another 25% to my local food bank

All proceeds from this pattern will be donated monthly to a rotating list of charities that work to make life better for ALL people, not just those in power. These will include Black Lives Matter, Standing Rock Legal Defense Funds, Days for Girls, Environmental Defense Fund, Trans Youth Equality Foundation, Engender Health, Flint Kids, and more. I’ll post a tally at the end of every month of the donations and where they’ll be sent. If you have a charity that you see doing good in the world, please let me know and I’ll check them out!

If you would rather donate to your own preferred charity, you can send me proof of the donation to bristol@bristolivy.com and I’ll gift you a copy of the pattern. However, I will not accept donations to any charities that are anti-abortion or exclude people based on their religious or sexual preferences, reproductive health choices, or race or ethnicity. Basic rule of thumb: if a charity supports a minority, thumbs up; if a charity excludes a minority, thumbs down.

Want to do a KAL or make kits? I’m all for it! But the same rules apply--please donate part of the proceeds to a charity that fits the above specifications. Contact me at the email address above and I’ll make sure to link it here.

807214.name: Nettle Tee
807214.gauge_description: 20 stitches and 32 rows = 4 inches in Stockinette stitch
807214.notes_html:
I first saw Nettle Grove at my local yarn store this spring and absolutely fell in love! What could be more idyllic that knitting with a naturally caustic plant that has been transformed through some sort of fiber-witchcraft into soft, sumptuous yarn? It’s almost too good to be true! I hope you enjoy knitting up this summery tee. The lace shaping in the neckline and the waist is actually a bit of a cheat; it’s secretly drop stitches! This will save you from the hassle of actually knitting lace and lets you get a little more mileage out of your yarn. I think the placement of the drop stitches is super flattering for all body types, so don’t be afraid to show a little skin, whatever your size! Girl, you beautiful; flaunt it!

If you need help with the drop-stitch bind off, please see the tutorial at https://youtu.be/1pEOiDJ5Z1w. It will show the basic tecnhique used to bind off drop stitches.

Sizes: 2XS (XS, S, M, L) (XL, 2X, 3X, 4X) to fit the following actual measurements:
2XS: 28” – 29”/ 70 – 74 cm
XS: 30” – 32”/ 76 - 82 cm
S: 33” – 35”/ 84 - 90 cm
M: 36” – 38”/ 92 - 96 cm
L: 40” – 42”/ 102 - 106 cm
XL:44” – 46”/ 112 - 116 cm
2X: 48” – 50”/ 122 - 128 cm
3X: 52” – 54”/ 132 - 138 cm
4X: 56” – 58”/ 142 - 148 cm
This pattern is written with about -2”/-5 cm of ease. If you would prefer zero- or positive-ease to your tee, bump up one or two sizes.

Yarn: 450 (475, 500, 550, 600) (650, 725, 800, 875) yard/415 (435, 455, 500, 550) (600, 665, 730, 800) meters of sport weight yarn.
I like a lightweight, summery plant fiber yarn for this pattern; not 100% animal fiber. Try linen, flax, hemp, silk, cotton. Nothing will work up better for this pattern than the yarn it was written for - Plymouth Yarn’s Nettle Grove (shown in colorway Seagrass).

Notions: 5 small stitch holders, 5 stitch markers, blocking mat, wires (optional, but highly recommended), t-pins, and a tapestry needle.

Techniques: Provisional CO, knitting in the round, seaming (don’t worry, only the shoulders are seamed!), basic increases and decreases, basic drop stitches, picking up stitches, wrap and turn, and blocking.

For first notice to opening of tests, new patterns, and as always, fantastic freebies, like me on Facebook:

Knitorious S H E
807214.notes:
I first saw Nettle Grove at my local yarn store this spring and absolutely fell in love! What could be more idyllic that knitting with a naturally caustic plant that has been transformed through some sort of fiber-witchcraft into soft, sumptuous yarn? It’s almost too good to be true! I hope you enjoy knitting up this summery tee. The lace shaping in the neckline and the waist is actually a bit of a cheat; it’s secretly drop stitches! This will save you from the hassle of actually knitting lace and lets you get a little more mileage out of your yarn. I think the placement of the drop stitches is super flattering for all body types, so don’t be afraid to show a little skin, whatever your size! Girl, you beautiful; flaunt it!

**If you need help with the drop-stitch bind off, please see the tutorial at [https://youtu.be/1pEOiDJ5Z1w][1]. It will show the basic tecnhique used to bind off drop stitches.** 

**Sizes:** 2XS (XS, S, M, L) (XL, 2X, 3X, 4X) to fit the following actual measurements:
2XS: 28” – 29”/ 70 – 74 cm
XS: 30” – 32”/ 76 - 82 cm
S: 33” – 35”/ 84 - 90 cm

L: 40” – 42”/ 102 - 106 cm
XL:44” – 46”/ 112 - 116 cm
2X: 48” – 50”/ 122 - 128 cm
3X: 52” – 54”/ 132 - 138 cm
4X: 56” – 58”/ 142 - 148 cm
This pattern is written with about -2”/-5 cm of ease. If you would prefer zero- or positive-ease to your tee, bump up one or two sizes. 

**Yarn:** 450 (475, 500, 550, 600) (650, 725, 800, 875) yard/415 (435, 455, 500, 550) (600, 665, 730, 800) meters of sport weight yarn. 
I like a lightweight, summery plant fiber yarn for this pattern; not 100% animal fiber. Try linen, flax, hemp, silk, cotton. Nothing will work up better for this pattern than the yarn it was written for - Plymouth Yarn’s Nettle Grove (shown in colorway Seagrass). 

**Notions:** 5 small stitch holders, 5 stitch markers, blocking mat, wires (optional, but highly recommended), t-pins, and a tapestry needle. 

**Techniques:** Provisional CO, knitting in the round, seaming (don’t worry, only the shoulders are seamed!), basic increases and decreases, basic drop stitches, picking up stitches, wrap and turn, and blocking.

833778.name: Sipila
833778.gauge_description: 22 stitches and 30 rows = 4 inches in stranded stockinette stitch
833778.notes_html:
Buy 3 get one free! Place 4 of my self-published patterns in your cart and the 4th (least expensive) will be free, no code needed!

Sipila is a Mother’s Day gift, firstly for my own mom, who taught me how to make my own clothes and knits all my patterns, just because! The name Sipila is my Finnish grandmother’s maiden name, and I named it for her in honor of all the wonderful mothers, grandmothers, daughters and in our lives. Thank you, Mom!

Yarn kits will be available from both of the indie dyers who provided yarn support for this project, Olann and House of A La Mode, please check their sites for details!

NOTES!
Sipila is knit from the top down in the round. There are options for either long or short sleeves included in the pattern; make sure you check the suggested yardage for the version you prefer, as the long sleeve version will require more yardage. The body length is easily customizable, but changing it will also affect the yardage, so please keep that in mind. If you are using hand painted or speckled yarn, it is highly recommended to alternate skeins for the main color (C1) to avoid noticeable color blocks and/or pooling. The contrast color (C2) doesn’t need to be alternated.
The gauge for this design is intentionally loose to create a drapey, lightweight fabric.

MATERIALS
Yarn
2 colors of fingering weight yarn, superwash singles are suggested.

Short sleeve sample uses Olann
Singles, 100% Superwash Merino
400 yards 366 m/100g
C1: Dame (violet)
C2: Love Vigilante (blush speckle)

Long Sleeve sample uses House of A La Mode
Fingering Single Ply, 100% Superwash Merino
400 yards 366 m/100g
C1: Bunny (white)
C2: Loon Lake (black multicolor)

Yardage
Short Sleeve
C1: 564 (627, 682, 750, 810, 866, 927, 975) yards
516 (573, 624, 686, 741, 792, 848, 892) m
C2: 176 (196, 214, 235, 253, 270, 289, 307) yards
157 (179, 196, 215, 247, 264, 281) m
Long Sleeve
C1: 819 (910, 990, 1088, 1175, 1260, 1344, 1426) yards
749 (832, 905, 995, 1074, 1152, 1229, 1304) m
C2: 308 (343, 373, 410, 443, 473, 506, 536) yards
282 (314, 341, 375, 405, 433, 463, 490) m

Needles:
Note! Needle size is suggested only, you will need to swatch to determine the needle size needed to achieve gauge.
US 2/ 2.75 mm
US 4/ 3.5 mm

Other Notions:
Stitch markers, stitch holders (or scrap yarn), tapestry needle

Gauge:
22 sts and 30 rounds over 4” 10 cm after blocking in both colorwork and stockinette.

Sizes:
Measurements given are for the finished garment. This sweater is designed to fit with 12-14” 30.5-35.5 cm of positive ease at the bust and 2” 5 cm of positive ease at the upper arm. The gauge is intentionally loose to create a fabric that drapes nicely and flatters the body. As the sleeve has less ease than the body, it is important to choose a size that will comfortably fit around the upper arm. Sizes are given as numbers, check the measurements to determine the proper size for your sweater.

1 (2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8) XXS (XS, S, M, L, XL, 2X, 3X)

Bust circumference:
38.5 (42.5, 46, 50.25, 54.25, 58.25, 62, 65)”
98 (108, 117, 127.5, 138, 148, 157.5, 165) cm

Sleeve circumference at upper arm:
11 (12, 12.5, 13, 14, 15.5, 17.5, 19)”
28 (30.5, 32, 33, 35.5, 39.5, 44.5, 48.5) cm

pattern_author.name: Caitlin Hunter
pattern_author.notes:
I love creating classic designs that inspire knitters to try new techniques and make their own beautiful heirlooms that can be treasured for generations. I am inspired by the sustainable/slow fashion movement, and believe knitting fits perfectly into this philosophy. Let's all slow down, knit some beautiful things and appreciate what we can do with our own hands!

> **You can save 35% on all of my self-published patterns by using the
> code KTOG, valid through the end of
> March. Thank you and happy knitting!**



Follow me on [Instagram][2]!

My website and newsletter sign up can be found [here][3]!

users.about_me:
Hi! I am Caitlin Hunter, Boyland Knitworks is the brand name for my knit designs. I am an Alaskan at heart, now living in Oregon with my husband and 3 little boys on our farm in the forest. 

Boyland Knitworks embraces slow fashion and ethically produced fiber. A handmade life is a wonderful life, take your time and create beautiful heirloom pieces to warm and nurture yourself and those you love.

I love to meet others who share my love of knitting and fiber arts, please come join my group [boyland knitworks][3]! That's also a great place for pattern support! Please check there first if you have a question about a pattern.

If you can't get your questions answered there, please email me at boylandknitworks@gmail.com

No Ravelry messages! <3

  [2]: https://knitstars.mykajabi.com/a/4441/WQ9soiS7
  [3]: http://www.ravelry.com/groups/boyland-knitworks

921518.name: April Tank Top
921518.gauge_description: 23 stitches and 36 rows = 4 inches in Stockinette stitch
921518.notes_html:
SALE! 40% off through April 3rd. No code needed, keep your spirits up with some knitting while you’re stuck at home!

The April Tank Top has a racer back with a high neckline. It is fitted at the bust and loose and flowy to the hips. There is lace on the back panel and the bottom hem. It is knit in one piece, mostly in the round, and has many little details that make this simple tank top just a little bit fancy!

This is a perfect warm-weather top!

Sizes
XS (S, M, L, XL, 2X, 3X)
Bust Size: 28 (32, 36, 40, 44, 48, 52) inches
71 (81, 91.5, 101.5, 112, 122, 132) cm
Designed to be worn with little to no positive ease at the bust.

Estimated Yardage: 658 (682, 780, 806, 889, 917, 1020) yards
Skeins of Peepaloo Fields Twist Sock:
2 (2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 3)
If making a 2X you might want to order a third skein just to be safe!
Also, please note that Peepaloo Fields Twist Sock has 464 yards per skein which is more than many!
